meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be tuned.
meanings.sent1: The tunabilities of the guitar strings allow for precise adjustments.
meanings.sent2: Musical instruments have different tunabilities to produce various sounds.
meanings.sent3: The piano's tunabilities decided to play a jazzy tune all by itself!
meanings.sent4: Her voice had the tunabilities of a finely tuned instrument, hitting every note perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The tunabilities of the radio were so sharp that even the faintest stations came in crystal clear.

meanings.definition: The ability to adjust or change in pitch or frequency.
meanings.sent1: His ear for tunabilities made him a great sound engineer.
meanings.sent2: The singer's tunabilities allowed her to hit high notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tunabilities were so good, it could mimic the sound of a bird!
meanings.sent4: The tunabilities of the wind chimes created a soothing melody in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: She marveled at the tunabilities of the old record player, adjusting the pitch with a gentle turn.
